text: Does anyone in here by chance know how to solve the HS Form Embed forcing a refresh on mobile iOS? I found the issue here: <https://integrate.HubSpot.com/t/ios-form-submission-always-reloads-page/430> - I also found someone with a solution here, but it didn’t work when I tried it. <https://integrate.HubSpot.com/t/ios-devices-redirection-issue/2165/6>
I have a portal that isn't pulling in the landing pages into staging, why?
MAN, I heard about this being addressed... I can't remember if this was coming up or just happened. I know someone else will chime in about this

Yeah, I just got wise to it. I’ve got a client that wants to grab an email, capture it, then on submit I basically tell JS to push a button to trigger a modal that pops up so they can add more info. LIke a two step process. It woks just fine, except on mobile iOS. The modal pops up, the page refreshes and you lose it. :persevere:
You can see it here: <https://info.zirtual.com/zirtual-s1-cpc>
what does your form embed code look like?
I'm wondering if you could do this
FYI the call actually fires. But it refreshes on IOS
so even if you throw in there it refreshes?
YES
Yep. It is because iOS does not support 204
ah
is there a way to setup the redirect url?
or does it just refresh the current page
It refreshes the current page. We don’t want a refresh at all
or a redirect
The redirect happens after step 2
right, we don't want that to happen, but it happens, so we have to figure out a a way to work with it.
HubSpot’s doc’s say that using “inlineMessage” should avoid a refresh, and it does, but to <@U38EZFVFE>’s point, because of the 204, it happens anyway and I can’t stop it… yet.
I would suggest adding a hidden field to the form. then on that page, have some hubl that checks to see if the person has that hidden field. So when the page refreshes, it loads the modal
I’m not sure I follow?
so when they come to the page the first time -- it doesn't show. but upon refresh because they filled out the form, then you check to see if that form has been filled out, and you trigger the modal
So, create a custom property in HS. Call it 'virtual assistant form filled' (or whatever you feel)
Ok now I’m starting to follow
add that to the form, as a hidden field, and checkbox it
so, after they fill out the form they now have that property
SO, in the case of mobile IOS users --
if the page refreshes --
In the page -- you check to see if the current hubl user has the virtual assistant property
if so, then trigger the modal
ok
shitty work around, but best I can come up wit
hey I appreciate it
It’s a shitty situation
I imagine the modal has another form?
Yup
you can put another hidden field in there
that way if someone has gone that far and iflled out the second form, that modal doesn't pop up on the original p-age
They get a redirect to a thank you page on a second submission.
in the modal
(in case they end back up on the this page
<https://info.zirtual.com/zirtual-s1-cpc>
which to me seems like a PPC ad
yeah they’re driving traffic to these pages
so that would seem odd for them to show up there again, but i've seen odd
LOL
Won’t argue with that
I’m gonna work on the workaround you suggested.
Thanks for your help!
So this is how I did this on a page
I created a workflow to add them to a list, then check against the list
then loop through all the lists to match what list ID I added them to
and then if they match, that is where you would put your script to trigger the modal
So you don’t need the hidden field in this case, just that they are added to a list
You can also set localstorage and check to see if it is there after the page refreshes, then do something.
That is how i get around it.
Local Storage is super powerful. But simple tool to use.
Thanks for the tip, Chad. I haven’t used it, but I’ll check it out
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
You can store any string even whole blocks of data.
That’s cool! No idea how to use it yet lol, but def cool.

Has anyone come up with a good way to have a true dev/stage/prod environment with HubSpot sites? I know there is the content staging but it doesnt help when testing things like blog topics, authors, blog pages in general and more. 

I'm trying to see if there is a way to build something out where you can have a dev site like <http://dev.examplesite.com|dev.examplesite.com> (or even one of the <http://client.hs-sites.com|client.hs-sites.com> domains) then be able to use something to say "ok, take the changes and toss them into <http://examplesite.com|examplesite.com>" I know if the pages were all done in code then you could probably rig something up but with the pages where there are drag and drop being used, its not so easy (especially if they bought a theme from the marketplace).
You CAN create a test blog on another portal and then migrate the templates to your client portal.
what about non-blog?

<@U2H3TT8F2> this exactly the kind of thing we need - especially for large "full site reskins" for example. It's almost like you need a stg version of templates, so dev versions can move on whilst the existing live site continues as-is. As it stands, without cloning dependencies such as templates, scripts, css etc. and then doing a "migrate" we've been unable to determine how to achieve this
Non blog can be staged.
I am having one issue tho. has any one run into an issue where the landing pages are not available in staging?
the hardest though is if a template is bought from marketplace you cant copy to portals
yeah. You can make a copy and then copy it
no?
yea i dont think LP's are able to be staged just website pages i think
no, i tried that, at least it didnt let me on the one i copied
hmm. Interesting.
I guess we know how the module marketplace will prevent theft then.
Yeah, it isnt perfect but it is better than the old 2 step that we used to have to do.
It is just a blog tho.
Recreating that in another portal is pretty easy.
crapy solution
Just confirmed in order to stage Landing pages I guess you have to have Enterprise Level
so one interesting thing i just tried is using <http://Skyvia.com|Skyvia.com> to copy over template to the portal. It looks like it moved it over, but i can't see it in the design manager
I have a Pro customer that we can stage LP so I don't think they need to be on Enterprise.
I think it has more to do with if LP are on a different domain (subdomain). I don't think Staging supports subdomains yet....maybe?
You need Website addon to stage landing pages
I've confirmed in a client portal that if their LP are on a subdomain they are not available in Staging.

so when i did the transfer over using skyvia, i now see that i have 3 templates in a folder but only 2 show up... would someone at HS (maybe <@U22PJPGK0> could point to someone) be able to check in this portal why the template isnt showing up?
If skyvia is using FTP, FTP only allows access to coded templates
im not sure how its doing it, ill have to look
is there anyway to get ftp for non-coded?
the non-coded files are JSON and not really intended to be edited directly
it looks like Skyvia connects with an API Key or OAuth
but i think your right, from the export it looks like its pull all the html and no JSON type stuff so its probably only going to work for coded templates...
Can you think of anyway where you can get a true dev/stage -> prod environment in HS?

One issue we recently ran into with a customer is there were menu changes that needed to be made (we didnt make the site/theme) so in order to make it work right, we would have to clone the menu (or rebuild it) then add that to a cloned template in order for them to preview it. Then we would have to go back and make the change to the live menu and delete the clones for housekeeping. 

Just seems it would be easier to have something like a dev/stage portal, make changes there, then click a "deploy to production portal" and have that info copy over
hey <@U38EZFVFE> we ended up using local storage -- good call
I hadn't used it yet but have seen it
set it on the form submit, then on page load check for it, if it exists, load modal and remove the value
super simple, cheap and easy
yep.. FYI.. it stayes forever if you dont remove it.
stays
there is no limit on how long it will stay in the browser unless you clear the item after you are done with it.
yup
The menu issue should be fixed by now. Let me know if you still experience this.
